Regarding the second question, it seems that the response encoding cannot be changed because the web.xml file has a locale-encoding-mapping-list element with a locale-encoding-mapping element that specifies the encoding as "ISO-8859-1" for the "zh\_TW" locale. This means that the response will always be encoded in "ISO-8859-1" for requests with a "zh\_TW" locale. To fix the issue, you can either change the encoding in the locale-encoding-mapping-list element to "utf-8" or change the locale of the request to something other than "zh\_TW".
